title: 12-year-old Omaha boy accidentally hit by shotgun blast; his injuries aren't considered life-threatening
content:
A 12-year-old boy was shot Wednesday evening when his brother fired a shotgun and the boy was accidentally struck by the blast, Omaha police said.
Officers responded to a radio call about 6 p.m. at a house near 123rd and Cuming Streets. They found that Cody Latham had sustained a gunshot wound. Latham was taken to Nebraska Medical Center for treatment. Police said his injuries were not considered life-threatening. He was, however, listed in critical condition Thursday at the hospital.
